ETYMOLOGY: Named after Badminton House in Gloucestershire, England, the seat of the Duke of Beaufort, where the game was played in the 1870s based on earlier Indian games (like Poona).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A racquet sport played by two opposing players (singles) or two opposing pairs (doubles) who score points by hitting a shuttlecock across a net.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种隔网对抗的球拍运动，由两名对手（单打）或两对对手（双打）进行，通过用球拍击打羽毛球（即“羽子”）过网得分，使对手无法合法回击。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Badminton is one of the fastest racquet sports in the world.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 羽毛球是世界上速度最快的球拍运动之一。
